title: An Optimized Protocol for the Generation of Cortical Neurons from human iPSCs under Defined Conditions
title_html: An Optimized Protocol for the Generation of Cortical Neurons from human iPSCs under Defined Conditions

authors.name: Clare L Parish

source.body: DO NOT vigorously pipette to single cell. Sometimes just the addition of the 1 ml is enough to distribute cells/clumps.

• 5 wells will be passaged into 1:2.5; 10x 48 wells for maintenance
  • Remaining 2.5 wells will be fixed for staining
hLam coat 13x 48 wells for passaging and allow >
for coating
NB: At this point in the CTX differentiation protocol, a significant amount of progenitor expansion will have occurred in response to FGF2 exposure. Typically, a 5/6-fold increase in the cell numbers in achieved from Day 0 seeding. Cell numbers from 1 well of a 48-well plate can yield between 1.5-2.0 x 106 neural progenitors. Cells seeded at 4.5 x 105 cells/cm2. Coat the required number of wells depending on specific application.

source.description: Ensure even distribution by moving the plate in a ‘figure 8’ pattern.

Fill well with PBS/Azide for long-term storage.
Image.
Remove sterile coverslips from Ethanol using sterile tweezers.
Place coverslips into 48-well plates and wash x 3 with 500 μL PBS-/-, with 5 min incubations, at Room temperature to remove all residual Ethanol.
Remove 48-well plate, containing PO-coated coverslips from the fridge and wash x 2 with 5-minute incubations at RT.
Add 300 μL of Poly-L-Ornithine (PO) to each well and incubate overnight at 4˚C. Each well should contain a single coverslip.
Add 190 µl of 5 µg/ml of L521 solution diluted in 1 x PBS +/+ to each well with a coverslip and incubate for 2 hours at 37˚C.
Dissociate cells as performed at D25 timepoint.
Add 300 µl of Accutase to each of the wells and place in the incubator for 10 minutes at 37˚C.
Following incubation, add 300 μL of CTX media to each well, harvest cells and transfer cell suspension into a clean 15 ml centrifuge tube.
Centrifuge cell suspension at 1,400 rpm for 4 minutes.
Media is aspirated and replaced with maturation media (NBB27 media) supplemented with BDNF (40 ng/ml), GDNF (40 ng/ml), dcAMP (0.05 mM), AA (200 nM) and laminin (1 μg/ml; Sigma-Aldrich).
Aspirate media and flick tube to dislodge pellet. Resuspend cells in (at least 5 ml) CTX base media supplemented with ROCKi, 10 µM.
Cortical neurons are maintained in this media with growth factors until Day 55, where a final immunocytochemical analysis for cortical patterning is performed.

description: This protocol is about cortical differentiation.
